results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Robyn Colls, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Kalihgat
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Terry Melvin recalls a cathartic event from his youth, when he travelled as a university student to India. In Calcutta, he worked in a hospice for the dying and destitute and tells of the experiences that have shaped and haunted the person his is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Melvin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : memories of Fitzroy : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: May Andy, Marlene Scerri, Kelvin Onus-King, Howard Edwards, Frances Gallagher, Deborah Deacon, Arika Waulu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Seven Indigenous leaders in the community tell of growing up in Fitzroy. From disperate backgrounds, they have all become heavily involved with the activism and community spirit of Fitzroy in Melbourne, to grow into inspirational leaders for generations to come. Here they share their experiences and passions, as well as the families and communities they love.

results.title: Victimised, Assimalised, Correctionalised
results.creator_credit: Howard Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a child, Howard Edwards was shunted from orphanage to orphanage. Made a ward of the state in 1956, he was abused and beaten wherever he was sent. His incarceration didn’t end there and for much of his adult life Howard was a target for police and he was often locked up at the slightest provocation. A large part of Howard’s journey towards healing involved reconnecting with his family, his work in the community and on the board of the Aboriginal Health Care Service.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: As a child, Howard Edwards was shunted from orphanage to orphanage. Made a ward of the state in 1956, he was abused and beaten wherever he was sent. His incarceration didn’t end there and for much of his adult life Howard was a target for police and he was often locked up at the slightest provocation. A large part of Howard’s journey towards healing involved reconnecting with his family, his work in the community and on the board of the Aboriginal Health Care Service.

group_siblings.title: Inheriting

results.title: Inheriting
results.brief_description: Arika Waulu has inherited quite a lot in her young life. A young fighter for social justice, her inheritance is two-fold. She inherited her land from her ancestors and her sense of social justice from her parents. But rather than take these things for granted, Arika embraces them.
results.description: Arika Waulu has inherited quite a lot in her young life. A young fighter for social justice, her inheritance is two-fold. She inherited her land from her ancestors and her sense of social justice from her parents. But rather than take these things for granted, Arika embraces them.

results.title: Growing up on Cummera
results.creator_credit: May Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: May is a Yorta Yorta woman who grew up on Cummera Gunja mission. She warmly reflects on her days there, swimming and listening the the elders tell their stories. Moved away from her community, she experienced racism and prejudice but from those experiences learnt to overcome the boundries that others set up for her. She has since committed to a lifetime of learning and teaching and linking children and family back to their communities.

results.title: Growing up in Fitzroy
results.creator_credit: Marlene Scerri, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marlene (Scerri) Young gives us a picture of what it was like to grow up in Fitzroy in the 1950s. She lovingly tells of the closeness to her extended family, the friends coming to stay over and the strong sense of community, especially the Christmas parades down Smith Street.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marlene Scerri, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
